paragraphs.text: The George Washington 250th Anniversary half dollar is a commemorative coin that was issued by the United States Mint to commemorate the 250th anniversary of the birth of George Washington.  The coin was authorized by Pub.L. 97–104.[1]

paragraphs.title: History
paragraphs.text: The George Washington 250th Anniversary half dollar was the first modern United States commemorative coin.[2]  Production of traditional commemorative coins had previously ended in 1954 with the Carver-Washington half dollar.[3]

paragraphs.title: Production and sales
paragraphs.text: Public Law 97-104 authorized a total mintage of 10,000,000 coins.[4]  Two varieties of the coin were produced, one with a proof finish (struck at the San Francisco Mint with the "S" mint mark) and one with an uncirculated finish (struck at the Denver Mint with the "D" mint mark).  A total of 4,894,044  proof and 2,210,458 uncirculated coins were produced and sold.[5]
